alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 11:17PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Greeley and Valley Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1116 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Hartsuff State Park to 6 miles northeast of Arcadia. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail, along with heavy rainfall of perhaps 1 to 2 inches in a short time. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ord, Elyria and Fort Hartsuff State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central Nebraska.
